title: Special High Risk Charter Flight, FTCA,  Z Hold, Use of Force Policies

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All current ICE policies, directives, and memoranda regarding or discussing Special High Risk Charter Flights
2. All current ICE policies, directives, and memoranda regarding or discussing settlement authority for Federal Tort Claims Act cases
3. All current ICE policies, directives, and memoranda or discussing issuance or implementation of Z holds
4.  All current ICE policies, directives, and memoranda or discussing use of force

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Al Otro Lado

Greetings SOCOM FOIA official

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I request any reports, statements, or other records generated by SOCOM personnel or SOCOM-affiliated federal personnel in connection with the widely covered incident involving the mistaken detention/interrogation of a Delta Air Lines pilot at a hotel in the Boston area. Please limit your search to records generated between the the detention of the pilot and the time you recieve this request. Please exclude media inquiries or responses, messages from members of the public regarding the incident, etc.

I am filing this request as a private individual on my own behalf and have no commercial or profit purpose in making this request. I am willing to pay all applicable fees, however I request a statement prior to proceeding if fees will exceed $100. I would prefer the request be fulfilled by email attachment or other electronic means.

Thank you for your assistance.

Sincerely,

Joseph Durso

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Police reports filed to Taylorsville Police Department referring to Rasheem Carter
- Police reports filed to the Smith County Sheriff's Department referring to Rasheem Carter
- Any incident reports filed to Taylorsville Police Department and Smith County Sheriff's Department referring to Rasheem Carter
- Any investigation file referring to the case of Rasheem Carter
- Any video footage the Taylorsville Police Department and Smith County Sheriff's Department has in the investigation into Rasheem Carter's death. Carter's family shared video footage of a trail camera showing Rasheem on a wooded trail near Taylorsville indicating that there is video footage. 
- Any emails to, from, and cc'ing Smith County Sheriff's Department head Charlie Crumpton that includes the keywords "Rasheem Carter" "Carter" "Rasheem" 
- Any emails to, from, and cc'ing Taylorsville Police Chief Gabe Horn that includes the keywords "Rasheem Carter" "Carter" "Rasheem" 

HuffPost reported that Smith County Sheriff's Department is overseeing the criminal investigation into Rasheem's death. Taylorsville Police Chief Gabe Horn told a local newspaper in December that Rasheem Carter filed a police report when he visited the station but declined to press any charges against whomever was threatening him. Police found Rasheem's body on November 2, 2022. https://www.natchezdemocrat.com/2022/12/07/family-seeking-answers-in-fayette-mans-death/

Local media reported that the Mississippi Bureau of Investigation stepped in to assist in the investigation into Rasheem Carter's death. https://www.wlbt.com/2023/03/22/mbi-asking-publics-help-rasheem-carter-death-investigation/ 

I'm a senior reporter for the Guardian, and the family has been outspoken about this case. The case is a matter of public interest given that the case has been unresolved at the moment, without a suspect in custody, and the case is under investigation. That said, I would request a rolling release of materials if possible.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Edwin Rios

Greetings FBI FOIA official

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I request any reports, statements, or other records generated in connection with the widely covered incident involving the mistaken detention/interrogation of a Delta Air Lines pilot involving your employees at a hotel in the Boston area. You can limit your search to the period between the detention of the pilot and 23:59 Eastern time on Friday, April 7th 2023. Please include records generated by the FBI, other federal agencies, other law enforcement entities, or the hotel. I am not seeking press/media inquiries or responses, messages from members of the public regarding the incident, etc.

I am filing this request as a private individual and have no commercial or profit purpose in making this request. I am willing to pay all applicable fees up to $100. I request a statement if fees will exceed that amount. I would prefer the request be fulfilled electronically by portal upload.

Thank you for your assistance.

Sincerely,

Joseph Durso
